Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 18145f7d91c9c76a4c0b62e82c9a60e49f8f2e4c
Add Details of the parameter this interface takes
Asking in general , I do not see much comments in any of the functions. Will we have any issue if we add some comment in a line of two indicating what we are doing here. Does it look redundant ?

Should we first disable the timer and then log the information error. Just in case we hit exception while creating the information errorlog then we will skip disabling the timer . I mean swap line 626 and 623 ?

Add @param[in] . 
I could not understand in which scenario we call the setSurvTimer() with false value ?
why is this hardcoded ? can you used the meson variable ?
i see Surveillance is implemented in oem layer, so it could be 'oem-ibm' instead of 'PLDM'
do want to mention how much time interval for Surveillance?
remote terminus all over the patch.

improve logs as suggested.
info(“Failed to stop surveillance timer while remote terminus status is ‘{HOST_TRANST_OFF}’ with Terminus ID ‘{ID}’ “)
can we have this function as private ? so no body can call explicitly timer to start/stop. let setSurvTimer do all the job.
can we have initialisation at constructor level both parameter?
any specific reason to initialise in the constructor?
it would be good if we initialise at constructor level since readability is good and easy to identify initialisation of variable and nit code.
dont see it done completely. please re-check.
isn't this redundant check ? we come here only if value is `not true`
